description: This course surveys standard algorithms and data structures with emphasis on implementation experience and complexity analysis. Topics include algorithmic strategies, fundamental computer algorithms, stacks, queues, lists, trees, hash tables, heaps and priority queues, compression, and decompression. Offered annually. Also counts toward neuroscience concentration. Prerequisites: MATH 232 (MATH 244 or MATH 252) and CSCI 251, or consent of the instructor.
name: Algorithms/Data Struc
notes: Prerequisite: CSCI 251 and a mathematics proof course. This course is open
only to senior and junior Computer Science majors. This course has class-year
prerequisites: Prerequisites: MATH 232 (MATH 244 or MATH 252) and CSCI 251, or consent of the instructor.
title: Algorithms and Data Structures
